platform_analysis package¶

Submodules¶

platform_analysis.git module¶

platform_analysis.git.convert_log_to_dict(input_text)[source]¶

Convert the git log output to json.

platform_analysis.git.get_commits_log(path)[source]¶

Get the history of the commits of a git repository into a dict.

platform_analysis.git.get_files_log(path)[source]¶

Get the history of each edited file in a git repository into a dict.

platform_analysis.git.git_local_repo_analysis(path, graph)[source]¶

Analyse a local git repository.

platform_analysis.git.git_remote_repo_analysis(url, path, graph)[source]¶

Clone, analyse (and then remove the local copy) a remote git repository.

platform_analysis.git.git_remote_repo_log(url, path, log_type)[source]¶

Clone, retrieve the log of (and then remove the local copy) a remote git repository.

platform_analysis.git.git_repo_analysis(git_files_log, graph)[source]¶

The main function of SNA for a git repo.

platform_analysis.github_analysis module¶

platform_analysis.github_analysis.check_none(value_to_check)[source]¶

Helper function that checks for None values from the GitHub APIs.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.clean_graph(graph)[source]¶

Check the missing attributes of every node, and add a “No” when it is not present. With this you can, for example, use the attribute for graph partitioning in Gephi

platform_analysis.github_analysis.comments_analysis(discussion, graph, comment_type)[source]¶

Analyse the discussion of a GitHub discussion. Add edges to the graph and return a graph of the specified discussion.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.fork_analysis(repository, graph)[source]¶

Analyse the forks of a repository.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.get_users(element, user_type, graph)[source]¶

Get users of a specific type from the GitHub repo.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.github_analysis(repository, username, userlogin, password, path)[source]¶

Analyse a specific repository.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.github_login(userlogin, username, password)[source]¶

Login on GitHub in order to retrieve a dict of repositories for a given username.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.issue_analysis(issue, graph)[source]¶

Analyse the discussion of a single issue.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.pull_requests_analysis(repository, graph)[source]¶

Analyse the discussion of pull requests of a repository.

platform_analysis.github_analysis.repo_analysis(repository, path, graph)[source]¶

Analyse a specific GitHub repo.

platform_analysis.hg module¶

platform_analysis.hg.get_log(projectpath)[source]¶

platform_analysis.sna module¶

platform_analysis.sna.graph_to_pandas_time_series(graph)[source]¶

Transform a graph into a pandas time series DataFrame.

platform_analysis.sna.save_graph(graph, filename, self_loops)[source]¶

Transform date on a graph to string and save as a graphml file

platform_analysis.sna.time_analysis(data, focus, interaction, structure)[source]¶

Analyse a pandas time series DataFrame. Returns a DataFrame. If structure == “combined”. Returns a Series with all the interactions merged.

platform_analysis.sna.type_stats(data, focus)[source]¶

Return a DataFrame or a dict of DataFrames for global type stats. Helper function for speeding up analysis.

platform_analysis.svn module¶

platform_analysis.svn.get_log(projectpath)[source]¶

platform_analysis.utils module¶

platform_analysis.utils.convert_log_to_dict(input_text)[source]¶

Convert the git log output to json.
